question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
Compute
\[\frac{\sin 13^\circ + \sin 47^\circ + \sin 73^\circ + \sin 107^\circ}{\cos 17^\circ}.\]
inference:
Using the sum-to-product formula, we have
\begin{align*}
\frac{\sin 13^\circ + \sin 47^\circ + \sin 73^\circ + \sin 107^\circ}{\cos 17^\circ} &= \frac{2\sin\left(\frac{13^\circ + 47^\circ}{2}\right)\cos\left(\frac{13^\circ - 47^\circ}{2}\right) + 2\sin\left(\frac{73^\circ + 107^\circ}{2}\right)\cos\left(\frac{73^\circ - 107^\circ}{2}\right)}{\cos 17^\circ}\\
&= \frac{2\sin 30^\circ \cos(-17^\circ) + 2\sin 90^\circ \cos(-17^\circ)}{\cos 17^\circ}\\
&= \frac{2\left(\frac{1}{2}\right)\left(-\cos 17^\circ\right) + 2(1)\left(-\cos 17^\circ\right)}{\cos 17^\circ}\\
&= \frac{-2\cos 17^\circ - 2\cos 17^\circ}{\cos 17^\circ}\\
&= \frac{-4\cos 17^\circ}{\cos 17^\circ}\\
&= \boxed{-4}.
\end{align*}
Final Answer: \boxed{-4}. I hope it is correct.
